name: Extendvs
body:
#Write Your Own Tools for Visual Studio
Visual Studio is a fully extensibility development platform. In addition to all of the powerful tools that it provides, you can also use tools written by the community as well as create your own tools. Visual Studio Extensions empower you to extend almost every part of Visual Studio:
* Add menu items and toolbars items that activate functionality you build
* Create tool windows that offer entirely new functionality
* Provide IntelliSense for emerging programming languages
* Offer light bulbs that help developers write better code
* Integrate new project types into Visual Studio

#Visual Studio Gallery
Once you've built your extension, share it! [The Visual Studio Gallery](https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/) makes your extensions available to thousands of Visual Studio users. Contribute to the Visual Studio community and show off your dev skills.

#Contribute
There are many ways to contribute to Extensibility
* [Submit bugs](
* Write your own extensions and share them on GitHub
* Engage with other Visual Studio Extension users and developers on [StackOverflow with the tag Visual-Studio-Extensions](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/visual-studio-extensions). 
* [Join the free Visual Studio Partner Program](http://www.vsipprogram.com)


#Visual Studio Extensibility Resources
Check out the [VS Extensibility Dev Center](http://aka.ms/extendvs), the extensibility samples, and the [extensibility documentation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb166030(v=vs.140).aspx) to learn more about building extensions.  

#Check Out Extensions from the Community
Here you can see other extensions that the Visual Studio Community has developed
* Web Essentials https://github.com/madskristensen/WebEssentials2015
* SideWaffle https://github.com/ligershark/side-waffle
